intro: Psychotria cujabensis, commonly known as the Amazonian psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and small, white or greenish flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
